channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pro-life advocates blast Trump team for pausing abortion pill lawsuit
item.description: Pro-life advocates slammed the Trump administration this week for stalling a federal lawsuit that seeks to keep mail-order abortion pills out of Louis...

item.title: Trump to bolster government response to drug addiction
item.description: President Trump is creating a new group Thursday aimed at bolstering the federal government's response to drug addiction and substance abuse.

item.title: The Dangerous Allure of Assisted Suicide
item.description: The establishment of a duty not to be burdensome in a society with legal suicide and our upside-down demographics is a recipe for mass murder.

item.title: As SAVE Act Stalls In The Senate, House Proposes Even More Robust Election Reforms
item.description: The MEGA Act includes many of the measures that election integrity-hating Democrats have fought so feverishly to kill.

item.title: What States Can Do When Sacred Spaces Are Violated
item.description: Ohio’s experience shows that states can successfully enact legislation to increase penalties for church disrupters.

item.title: Renoir Drawings Raises a Question: Did Even Renoir Think His Drawings Were Important?
item.description: Plus, a great Caravaggio and Bellini as special guests.

item.title: FDA Wants Pause On Landmark Abortion Pill Suit. Pro-Lifers Say It Will Cost Lives
item.description: The FDA hinted it does not plan to weigh on the safeguards stripped under Biden until its mifepristone review is complete.

item.title: Can the Feds Really Prosecute the Minnesota Church Protesters?
item.description: Conservatives should be wary of supporting a federal prosecution like this.

item.title: LinkedIn Blames ‘Error’ After Removing Pro-ICE Post Over ‘Hateful Speech’
item.description: 'LinkedIn just proved once again that their woke censorship machine is still running full throttle,' SFCN President Andy Roth told The Federalist.

item.title: ‘October 7: In Their Own Words’ Gives Kennedy Center Audience Permission To Remember
item.description: October 7 offers something rare: moral clarity without instruction, faith without propaganda, and testimony without shame.
